lines.gurmukhi: jYsy rYin smY sb log mY sMjog Bog ckeI ibEg sog Bwg hInu jwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Raini Samai Sab Log Mai Sanjog Bhoga , Chakaee Biaog Sog Bhaag Heenu Jaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as everyone enjoys the company of their dear ones at night, but a ruddy sheldrake is considered unfortunate having been separated from its beloved.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy idnkir kY audoiq joiq jgmg aulU AMD kMD prcIn aunmwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Dinakari Kai Udoti Joti Jagamaga , Uloo Andh Kandh Paracheen Ounamaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as sunrise brightens up the place but an owl is seen hidden in dark allays and walls.

lines.gurmukhi: srvr sirqw smuMdR jl pUrn hY qiRKwvMq cwqRk rhq bk bwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Saravar Saritaa Samoundr Jal Pooran Hai , Trikhaavant Chaatrak Rahat Bak Baaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ponds, streams and oceans are seen to be full to the brim with water, but longing for rain, a rain-bird remains thirsty and keeps wailing and crying for that Swati drop.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy imil swDsMig skl sMswr qirE moih AprwDI AprwDnu ibhwnIAY ]509]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Mili Saadhasangi Sakal Sansaar Tariao , Mohi Aparaadhee Aparaadhanu Bihaaneeai ?509?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly by associating themselves with the congregation of the True Guru, the whole world is sailing across the worldly ocean but I, the sinner is spending all his life in evil deeds and vices.  (509)
